svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - March 18 2023

title: "Week in Ethereum News
March 18, 2023" date: "2023-03-18"
Eth News and Links
Shapella (Shanghai + Capella) upgrade
• Withdrawals are coming to mainnet on April 12 with the Shapella upgrade
Withdrawals are coming to mainnet on April 12 with the Shapella upgrade
• Goerli testnet successfully upgraded to Shapella, testnet finalized after validators updated their
clients, withdrawals & BLS credential changes are being processed
Goerli testnet successfully upgraded to Shapella, testnet finalized after validators updated their
• Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Summary by Tim Beiko. Notes from Tim Beiko &
Christine Kim : Mainnet Shapella upgrade scheduled, client releases expected in a week Discussion on
EL suggesting local blocks, consider after Shapella Potential Cancun EIPs: SSZ minimal scope,
SELFDESTRUCT removal, EVM MAX, BLS, transient storage, beacon state root in EVM, EOF, SWAPN & DUPN
opcodes & PAY opcode Ethereum Cat Herders client diversity survey results
Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Summary by Tim Beiko. Notes from Tim Beiko &
Christine Kim :
• Mainnet Shapella upgrade scheduled, client releases expected in a week
Mainnet Shapella upgrade scheduled, client releases expected in a week
• Discussion on EL suggesting local blocks, consider after Shapella
Discussion on EL suggesting local blocks, consider after Shapella
• Potential Cancun EIPs: SSZ minimal scope, SELFDESTRUCT removal, EVM MAX, BLS, transient storage,
beacon state root in EVM, EOF, SWAPN & DUPN opcodes & PAY opcode
Potential Cancun EIPs: SSZ minimal scope, SELFDESTRUCT removal, EVM MAX, BLS, transient storage,
• Ethereum Cat Herders client diversity survey results
Ethereum Cat Herders client diversity survey results
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
• KZG Ceremony: First general contribution period is closed , people already in the lobby get to
contribute Special contribution period April 1-16
KZG Ceremony:
• First general contribution period is closed , people already in the lobby get to contribute
First general contribution period is closed , people already in the lobby get to contribute
• Special contribution period April 1-16
Special contribution period April 1-16
• consensus-specs v1.3.0-rc.4 : additional Deneb test vectors
consensus-specs v1.3.0-rc.4 : additional Deneb test vectors
• EIP4844 fee market analysis : data price of 1 wei sets wrong expectations and incentivizes spammy
use of blobs
EIP4844 fee market analysis : data price of 1 wei sets wrong expectations and incentivizes spammy use
of blobs
Layer 1
• Slot finder to pick time for network upgrades ( on historical roots boundary )
Slot finder to pick time for network upgrades ( on historical roots boundary )
• Geth patched transaction pool DoS vulnerability found on Goerli testnet
Geth patched transaction pool DoS vulnerability found on Goerli testnet
• Nimbus v23.3.0 added support for running multiple execution clients
Nimbus v23.3.0 added support for running multiple execution clients
• Draft proposal to replace SELFDESTRUCT with DEACTIVATE
Draft proposal to replace SELFDESTRUCT with DEACTIVATE
• Withdrawals: Coinbase expected ~24 hours after Shapella and Lido expected mid May
Withdrawals: Coinbase expected ~24 hours after Shapella and Lido expected mid May
Client releases
• Consensus layer: Nimbus v23.3.1 : config handling fixes, improves stability with Besu and fault
tolerance when running multiple execution clients
Consensus layer:
• Nimbus v23.3.1 : config handling fixes, improves stability with Besu and fault tolerance when
running multiple execution clients
• Execution layer: Nethermind v1.17.2 : fixes bad block production when an empty block was scheduled
Execution layer:
• Nethermind v1.17.2 : fixes bad block production when an empty block was scheduled
Research
• Encrypted transaction pools to address MEV & censorship
Encrypted transaction pools to address MEV & censorship
• Transaction auctions with same trust assumptions as today to give some MEV back to users
Transaction auctions with same trust assumptions as today to give some MEV back to users
• Idea for Subgame Credible anti-MEV mechanism to retroactively penalize harms
Idea for Subgame Credible anti-MEV mechanism to retroactively penalize harms
For Stakers
• Withdrawals explainer : automated process but withdrawal key needs to be an Ethereum address, no
need to rush BLS credential change unless mnemonic compromised
Layer 2
• Arbitrum One & Nova moved to on-chain DAO governance with 9 of 12 security council (for emergency
updates), token airdrop next week with 12.75% for users and 1.13% for Protocol Guild & DAOs with
treasuries on Arbitrum; Arbitrum Orbit announced: permissionless creation of L3s
Arbitrum One & Nova moved to on-chain DAO governance with 9 of 12 security council (for emergency
• Aztec: sunsetting Aztec Connect to focus on their zkEVM rollup
Aztec: sunsetting Aztec Connect to focus on their zkEVM rollup
• Patrick McCorry: defining rollups both by the community and the validating bridge
Patrick McCorry: defining rollups both by the community and the validating bridge
EIPs/Standards
• EIPs: EIP6690 : EVM modular arithmetic extensions (EVM MAX) decoupled from EOF
EIPs:
• EIP6690 : EVM modular arithmetic extensions (EVM MAX) decoupled from EOF
• ERCs: ERC6682 : NFT Flashloans
ERCs:
• ERC6682 : NFT Flashloans
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Nexus Mutual
What's so special about Nexus Mutual v2?
This upgrade makes the Nexus Mutual protocol an infrastructure layer enabling an on-chain risk
marketplace .
Now anyone can build on top of the Nexus Mutual protocol to share any risk -- and not just
crypto-related risks.
Don’t worry, you can still buy coverage of your DeFi assets !
Stuff for developers
• EVM language design : overview of Solidity, Vyper, Fe, Huff, ETK and Yul
EVM language design : overview of Solidity, Vyper, Fe, Huff, ETK and Yul
• Calldata encoding deep dive
Calldata encoding deep dive
• Gas analysis of clones vs naive factories : only use clones for low throughput
Gas analysis of clones vs naive factories : only use clones for low throughput
• Function dispatcher optimization using Huff
Function dispatcher optimization using Huff
• Ganache JSON-RPC reference , run RPC methods using Ganache in the browser
Ganache JSON-RPC reference , run RPC methods using Ganache in the browser
• web3.py v6 : Python v3.10/11 support, AsyncHTTPProvider , safe & finalized block identifiers,
improved multithreading, improved customization and CCIP Read support
web3.py v6 : Python v3.10/11 support, AsyncHTTPProvider , safe & finalized block identifiers, improved
multithreading, improved customization and CCIP Read support
• Sourcify v2 : reusable lib-sourcify library to verify a contract using the source, chain & address
Sourcify v2 : reusable lib-sourcify library to verify a contract using the source, chain & address
• BlockSec Phalcon transaction explorer adds debugging & improved transaction sharing
BlockSec Phalcon transaction explorer adds debugging & improved transaction sharing
• Pyrometer : security tool for contract analysis, alpha
Pyrometer : security tool for contract analysis, alpha
• Paradigm data portal : public datasets for contract bytecode & metadata, ETH transfers and contract
slots, parquet file format
Paradigm data portal : public datasets for contract bytecode & metadata, ETH transfers and contract
• Worldcoin: World ID protocol & SDK with phone number & privacy-preserving iris verifications
Worldcoin: World ID protocol & SDK with phone number & privacy-preserving iris verifications
Security
• Euler Finance $197 million exploit , lack of health check in donation mechanism
Euler Finance $197 million exploit , lack of health check in donation mechanism
• ParaSpace exploit blocked by BlockSec with 2.9k ETH rescued
ParaSpace exploit blocked by BlockSec with 2.9k ETH rescued
• Immunefi Proof of Concept templates using Foundry: reentrancy, token balance manipulation, flash
loan and price manipulation
Immunefi Proof of Concept templates using Foundry: reentrancy, token balance manipulation, flash loan
and price manipulation
Ecosystem
• Finematics: withdrawals explainer
Finematics: withdrawals explainer
• EF’s Next Billion fellowship cohort 3, applications close April 28
EF’s Next Billion fellowship cohort 3, applications close April 28
• Vitalik: choosing guardians for multisig & social recovery wallets
Vitalik: choosing guardians for multisig & social recovery wallets
Enterprise
• NAB (Australian bank) pilots intra-bank cross border stablecoin transaction
NAB (Australian bank) pilots intra-bank cross border stablecoin transaction
• Microsoft Edge browser testing native crypto wallet
Microsoft Edge browser testing native crypto wallet
• Meta winding down NFT efforts for now
Meta winding down NFT efforts for now
Application layer
• Bank run panic caused USDC to depeg outside banking hours: Uniswap nearly $12 billion in daily
volume MEV-Boost payments all time high $DAI depegged, generally even more than USDC Maker reduced
governance execution delay to 16 hours and added PSM circuit breaker
Bank run panic caused USDC to depeg outside banking hours:
• Uniswap nearly $12 billion in daily volume
Uniswap nearly $12 billion in daily volume
• MEV-Boost payments all time high
MEV-Boost payments all time high
• $DAI depegged, generally even more than USDC
$DAI depegged, generally even more than USDC
• Maker reduced governance execution delay to 16 hours and added PSM circuit breaker
Maker reduced governance execution delay to 16 hours and added PSM circuit breaker
• Nexus Mutual v2 live on mainnet, cover for crypto-native & real world risks, cover as NFTs
Nexus Mutual v2 live on mainnet, cover for crypto-native & real world risks, cover as NFTs
• Sismo zkConnect : private single sign-on, beta
Sismo zkConnect : private single sign-on, beta
• Stealcam : NFT photos only the holder can view, pixelated for everyone else, live on Arbitrum
Stealcam : NFT photos only the holder can view, pixelated for everyone else, live on Arbitrum
• POAP Drops : streamlined creation, view past drops and manage existing POAPs
POAP Drops : streamlined creation, view past drops and manage existing POAPs
• DAO Drops (retroactive public goods funding): allocate $250k DAI from EF grant. Voting power given
to contract deployers, POAP collectors and DAO voters. Vote by March 24
DAO Drops (retroactive public goods funding): allocate $250k DAI from EF grant. Voting power given to
contract deployers, POAP collectors and DAO voters. Vote by March 24
Job Listings
• Nimbus is hiring a Site Reliability Engineer
Nimbus is hiring a Site Reliability Engineer
• Frax Finance is expanding their official core developer team. Apply here!
Frax Finance is expanding their official core developer team. Apply here!
• L2BEAT 💗 is hiring a Senior Software Engineer & Product Owner. Apply here!
L2BEAT 💗 is hiring a Senior Software Engineer & Product Owner. Apply here!
• Immutable is hiring a Principal Product Security Engineer
Immutable is hiring a Principal Product Security Engineer
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit), payable in ETH/DAI/USDC to abcoathup.eth on
mainnet or Layer 2. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
• FDIC fully protected deposits at SVB & Signature Bank, which helped restabilize USDC
FDIC fully protected deposits at SVB & Signature Bank, which helped restabilize USDC
• US Fed denies Caitlin Long’s Custodia Bank membership application (custodial only, no fractional
reserves)
US Fed denies Caitlin Long’s Custodia Bank membership application (custodial only, no fractional
• Blockchain Association collecting evidence of crypto debanking
Blockchain Association collecting evidence of crypto debanking
• Data visualization on implied versus realized volatility in crypto options [ Starbloom portfolio]
Data visualization on implied versus realized volatility in crypto options [ Starbloom portfolio]
• Mint first : creators should mint content as NFTs and then amplify on social media
Mint first : creators should mint content as NFTs and then amplify on social media
General/crypto
• PeopleDAO 76 ETH social engineering exploit , payment added to Google sheet shared in Discord
PeopleDAO 76 ETH social engineering exploit , payment added to Google sheet shared in Discord
• Semacaulk : zk set membership protocol, reduces insert gas from 1M to 68k (using KZG commitments
instead of Merkle trees), proof of concept
Semacaulk : zk set membership protocol, reduces insert gas from 1M to 68k (using KZG commitments
• CASPER : secret channel attack via computer's internal speaker to a mobile phone at 20bits/sec
CASPER : secret channel attack via computer's internal speaker to a mobile phone at 20bits/sec
• Vespass : password manager, uses secret sharing & hardware enclaves, no master password
Vespass : password manager, uses secret sharing & hardware enclaves, no master password
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup and
@evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-march-18-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
• Mar 21 – deadline for Summer of Protocols
Mar 21 – deadline for Summer of Protocols
• Mar 24 – deadline to vote for DAO drops
Mar 24 – deadline to vote for DAO drops
• Mar 28-30 – Ethereum Rio
Mar 28-30 – Ethereum Rio
• Mar 31 - Apr 2 – ETHSamba (Rio) hackathon & conference
Mar 31 - Apr 2 – ETHSamba (Rio) hackathon & conference
• Mar 31 – deadline for EF account abstraction grants round
Mar 31 – deadline for EF account abstraction grants round
• Apr 5-8 – ETH Beijing hackathon
Apr 5-8 – ETH Beijing hackathon
• Apr 12 – Mainnet upgrades to Shapella
Apr 12 – Mainnet upgrades to Shapella
• Apr 12-14 – NFT NYC
Apr 12-14 – NFT NYC
• Apr 13-16 – Pragma Tokyo & ETHGlobal Tokyo hackathon
Apr 13-16 – Pragma Tokyo & ETHGlobal Tokyo hackathon
• Apr 14-16 – EthereumZuri.ch conference & hackathon
Apr 14-16 – EthereumZuri.ch conference & hackathon
• Apr 21-25 – EthTaipei hackathon & conference
Apr 21-25 – EthTaipei hackathon & conference
• Apr 27-30 – Istanbul ETH Privacy conference & hackathon
Apr 27-30 – Istanbul ETH Privacy conference & hackathon
• Apr 28 – deadline for EF’s Next Billion fellowship cohort 3
Apr 28 – deadline for EF’s Next Billion fellowship cohort 3
• May 5-10 – ETHTallinn hackathon & NFT Tallinn conference
May 5-10 – ETHTallinn hackathon & NFT Tallinn conference
• May 9-12 – EY blockchain summit
May 9-12 – EY blockchain summit
• May 12-14 – ETHGlobal Lisbon
May 12-14 – ETHGlobal Lisbon
• May 19-23 – EDCON Montenegro (changed from Vienna)
May 19-23 – EDCON Montenegro (changed from Vienna)
• May 20-21 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
May 20-21 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
• May 24-26 – Spaghett ETH (Naples) conference
May 24-26 – Spaghett ETH (Naples) conference
• May 26-28 – ETHDublin hackathon
May 26-28 – ETHDublin hackathon
• Jun 2-4 – ETH Seoul
Jun 2-4 – ETH Seoul
• Jun 2-6 – ETH Belgrade conference & hackathon
Jun 2-6 – ETH Belgrade conference & hackathon
• Jun 9-11 – ETHPrague conference & hackathon
Jun 9-11 – ETHPrague conference & hackathon

Jun 23–25 – ETHGlobal Waterloo (changed from Toronto)
• Jul 5-7 – ETHBarcelona
Jul 5-7 – ETHBarcelona
• Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
• Jul 21–23 – ETHGlobal Paris
Jul 21–23 – ETHGlobal Paris
• Aug 16-19 – Ethereum Argentina (Buenos Aires)
Aug 16-19 – Ethereum Argentina (Buenos Aires)
• Aug 30 - Sep 3 – ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon
Aug 30 - Sep 3 – ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon
• Sep 1-3 – Ethcon Korea hackathon
Sep 1-3 – Ethcon Korea hackathon
• Sep 10-12 – Ethereum Singapore hackathon & conference
Sep 10-12 – Ethereum Singapore hackathon & conference
• Sep 11-13 – DappCon (Berlin)
Sep 11-13 – DappCon (Berlin)
• Sep 15 – Protocol Berg (Berlin)
Sep 15 – Protocol Berg (Berlin)
• Sep 22–24 – ETHGlobal New York
Sep 22–24 – ETHGlobal New York
